definition: to shake/to flap/to vibrate/to resonate/to rise up with spirit/to rouse oneself

sentences.english: As the recession deepens, Barbie’s conservative values are also back in vogue.
sentences.chinese: 隨經濟蕭條惡化，芭比娃娃的保守價值也重振雄風。

sentences.english: The King of Yue, Gou Jian submitted and sued for peace.
sentences.chinese: 後越王勾踐臥薪嚐膽，任用文種和范蠡重振國政。

sentences.english: History says that banks bounce back from legal problems.
sentences.chinese: 回顧歷史，大多銀行能從法律糾紛中重振雄風。

sentences.english: I scrimp together leftover bits of backbone from an earlier era and hear myself say no.
sentences.chinese: 我重振早期剩下的那一點信心，聽到自己說“不行”。

sentences.english: Well, I had a couple of friends who were interested in reestablishing the club
sentences.chinese: 我的許多朋友都想重振那個俱樂部。

sentences.english: When will the Chinese women's volleyball team experience a revival?
sentences.chinese: 中國女排何時能重振雄風？

sentences.english: This he did, and again the company quickly rebounded.
sentences.chinese: 他這樣做了，公司很快就重振聲威了。

sentences.english: Reinvigorating democratic spirit is helpful to impel the development of contemporary design.
sentences.chinese: 重振民主主義精神有助於推動當代藝術設計的發展。

sentences.english: They rallied their spirits and threw themselves into the battle.
sentences.chinese: 他們重振精神投入戰鬥。

sentences.english: One of the keys to regain its splendour and fascination is to embrace life tightly.
sentences.chinese: 而重振雄風的關注之一是緊緊擁抱生活。

sentences.english: Let me repeat some figures that support the revival of optimism.
sentences.chinese: 請讓我重複一些數字，對重振樂觀的態度提供支持。

sentences.english: We have no assurance it will create jobs or revive the economy.
sentences.chinese: 我們不能保證它將創造就業機會或者重振經濟。

sentences.english: America's banks received extraordinary a istance from American taxpayers to rebuild their industry.
sentences.chinese: 美國銀行從納稅人那裏得到巨大援助來重振金融業。

sentences.english: Objective To discuss methods of hearing aids fitting for hearing-impaired people with loudness recruitment.
sentences.chinese: 目的探討伴有重振的聽力障礙者助聽器驗配方法。

sentences.english: Most financial professionals came to worship liquidity as the silver bullet for reviving economies.
sentences.chinese: 多數金融專家來崇拜流動資金作爲銀彈重振經濟。

sentences.english: Few object to the goal of reinvigorating trade.
sentences.chinese: 很少有人反對重振貿易的目標。

definition: Fuxing district of Handan city 邯鄲市|邯郸市[Han2 dan1 shi4], Hebei/Fuxing or Fuhsing township in Taoyuan county 桃園縣|桃园县[Tao2 yuan2 xian4], north Taiwan
Zhengxing district of Dandong city 丹東市|丹东市[Dan1 dong1 shi4], Liaoning
lit. to return to office after living as a hermit on Mount Dongshan (idiom); fig. to make a comeback
lit. to reorganize flags and drums (idiom); to regroup after a setback/to prepare for new initiatives/to attempt a comeback
to break out of a crisis
to bestir oneself/to pull oneself together/to cheer up/to uplift/to stimulate
lit. to upend heaven and earth (idiom)/fig. to change the course of events/to turn things around
the mission in life of a deceased person, left to others to carry on
